cmd_add_left_tab_in_this_group.message: Add left ungrouped tab to current group

cmd_add_right_tab_in_this_group.message: Add right ungrouped tab to current group

cmd_group_by_domain_with_name.message: Group all tabs by domain name - set group name and collapse

cmd_group_by_domain_without_name.message: Group all tabs by domain name - don't set group name and expand

cmd_move_group_left.message: Move current group/tab to the left (group awareness)

cmd_move_group_right.message: Move current group/tab to the right (group awareness)

cmd_move_group_window.message: Move current group to new window

cmd_move_tab_left.message: Move current tab to the left (group unawareness)

cmd_move_tab_right.message: Move current tab to the right (group unawareness)

cmd_next_tab_in_group.message: Active next tab in current group

cmd_previous_tab_in_group.message: Active previous tab in current group

cmd_remove_group.message: Close current group (close all tabs in the group)

cmd_remove_tabs_not_in_this_group.message: Close all tabs not in current group

extDescription.message: Automatically group tabs, save tabs/groups, and provide shortcuts for tabs/groups.

hBasic.message: Tab Groups Creation and Basic Operations:

hBasic_1.message: Select one or more tabs with the mouse, then use the shortcut key (Alt+Shift+G by default) to create a group.

hBasic_2.message: Select one or more tabs with the mouse, then right-click a tab to create a group or move to an existing group.

hBasic_3.message: Set up grouping rules to automatically create groups for tabs.

hBasic_4.message: Drag a tab left/right to move it into or out of groups.

hBasic_5.message: Right-click the group label to modify the group name, color and other functions.

hBasic_6.message: Click the group label to collapse or expand the group.

hBasic_7.message: Drag the group label left/right to move the group as a whole.

hBasic_8.message: Click this extension icon to manage and save tabs or groups in the popup page, as well as set grouping rules and keyboard shortcuts.

hPin.message: Pin this extension. It will show on your address bar.

hRule2.message: Create matching rules for a group rule. It supports the following matching targets:

hRule2_1.message: Hostname is the domain part (excluding port number) of full URL, e.g. www.example.com

hRule2_3.message: Page title is the title of the tab

hSave1.message: Open a saved tab or group.

hSave3.message: Delete a saved tab or group.

hSave6.message: All saved groups are collapsed by default.

hSave7.message: Set max snapshots for a named group.

hShortcut.message: Setup your custom keyboard shortcuts for functions you like.

kb_c.message: Close a tab or group for opened tabs

kb_ctrl_enter.message: Open a tab without closing the popup

kb_ctrl_o.message: Open a tab or group without closing the popup

kb_enter.message: Activate or open a tab; Collapse or expand a group

kb_esc.message: Exit input focus; close context menu; close popup page

kb_hash.message: Delete a tab or group for saved tabs

kb_next_row.message: Jump to next tab or group

kb_next_top_row.message: Jump to next top-level tab or group

kb_o.message: Activate or open a tab; Open a group

kb_pre_row.message: Jump to previous tab or group

kb_pre_top_row.message: Jump to previous top-level tab or group

kb_s.message: Save a tab or group for opened tabs

kb_shift_enter.message: Open a tab in a new window

kb_shift_o.message: Open a tab or group in a new window

pT1Head.message: All Tabs and Groups in Current Window

pT2Expand.message: Collapse all groups by default (to reduce space usage)

pT2GroupTitle.message: Open All Tabs in This Group

pT2Tip.message:
Open without closing the popup: Ctrl + Click
Open in a new window: Shift + Click
Open all pages of a group: Click the group
Merge groups with the same name: Click button

pT3GroupByDomain.message: Automatically group by domain name (it will disable all other rules)

pT3OneInAll.message: Only allow one group with the same name in all windows

pT3Scope.message: Also apply rules to already grouped tabs

pT3Tip.message:
Rules take effect only when the page changes.
Rules are automatically synchronized when you turn on the browser sync settings.

pT4Caption1.message: Shortcuts Used in This Popup Page

pT4Caption2.message: Shortcuts Used in the Browser (Set by You as Needed)

pT4Tip.message: ⚠️ Due to a browser bug, when you modify the shortcut key of "Activate the extension", it will not take effect immediately (there is no such problem when you modify other shortcut keys). You can disable and re-enable this extension in the extension management, or relaunch the browser to make it take effect.

rHMethodL5.message: For regular expression matching, please refer to RegExp.test(). Note that, unlike string literals in programming language source code, the input of regular expression here does not require escaping "\" and quotation marks.

rHNoteL1.message: Rules only perform a match when a tab changes, such as when a new tab is opened or when the URL or title of the page changes.

rHNoteL2.message: By default, rules do not change tabs that are already in a group. But if current tab navigates to another site and you want to re-group it by rules, you can check "The popup → Group Rules → Also apply rules to already grouped tabs" option.

rHNoteL3.message: Browser has a default behavior: new tabs that opened from a group automatically belong to this group. If the rule matches, and you want to override this default behavior, you can also check "The popup → Group Rules → Also apply rules to already grouped tabs" option.

rHNoteL4.message: When you use multiple browser windows, if you want to have only one group with the same name in all windows (which may move the newly opened tab to an already existing group in another window), you can check "The popup → Group Rules → Only allow one group with the same name in all windows" option.

rHTargetL1.message:
The full URL of the page, i.e. the entire content of the address bar, e.g.
https://www.example.com/path/page.html?param=abc#section

rHTargetL2.message: The hostname is the domain part of the full URL, such as www.example.com, excluding the port number.

rHTargetL3.message: Page title, which is the text displayed on the tab, such as "Article Title - Website Name".

rHTargetP1.message: Each tab in the browser displays a page. Rules can match the following information of pages:

rHTargetP2.message: For example, to automatically add all pages from the example.com website to a group, you only need to create a matching rule of "Hostname includes example.com".

rMMatchTip.message: You can add multiple matching rules. If a tab matches, it will be automatically added to the group.
